newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola rises on commercials, crushers.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola rises on commercials, crushers.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended up on commercial and crusher demand, traders said.

"We had good commercial buying with some hedges and crushers bought about 500 November in the past two days," a trader said. Sep-Nov spread at $5, Jan-Mar at $2.50. Volume was 2,900 lots, or 58,000 tonnes, including 275 hedge lots.

September canola rose $0.90 to $425.60, November rose $1.10 to $431.40. October flax fell $0.20 to $392.30, January rose $1.50 to $365 with 80 Oct-Jan spreading at $28, five Oct Nov spread at $29. Volume was 239 lots, or 4,780 tonnes.
Feed wheat's Oct-Dec spread widened to $13.50 then $14 from Wednesday's $12.50. October closed $3.60 higher at $205.60 and December was up $1.60 to $191.10 on commercial demand. Volume was 855 lots.
November western barley rose $0.40 to $159.30 after commission selling took it down to $158 and triggered moderate commercial demand, a trader said. Volume was 1,100 lots.
One hundred October feed peas traded down US$0.50 to US$203.50.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
